chess

Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.GameBoard

  • public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the GameBoard as a 2D array of Piece Objects.
    Author:
    Derek Schatel

      This method tests whether castling is possible.

      Checks to see if the piece to be moved has an unobstructed path to its destination.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes the gameboard to its starting state, filling the starting positions with pointers to Piece objects of the appropriate type.

      • checkPath

        public boolean checkPath(int oldRow,
                         int oldCol,
                         int newRow,
                         int newCol)
        Checks to see if the piece to be moved has an unobstructed path to its destination.
        Parameters:
        oldRow - Starting row value
        oldCol - Starting column value
        newRow - Destination row value
        newCol - Destination column value
        Returns:
        boolean designating whether the path is clear

      • getBoard

        public Piece[][] getBoard()
        Getter method to retrieve the game board instance.
        Returns:
        gameBoard

      • execute

        public void execute(int row,
                    int col,
                    Piece value)
        Setter method for moving pointer references of Piece objects.
        Parameters:
        row - Row location
        col - Column location
        value - Piece value to set location to

      • castling

        public boolean castling(int oldRow,
                        int oldCol,
                        int newRow,
                        int newCol)
        This method tests whether castling is possible. If it is, it performs a castling manuever.
        Parameters:
        oldRow - Row of king to be castled
        oldCol - Column of king to be castled
        newRow - Row destination for castling
        newCol - Column destination for castling
        Returns:
        boolean value for whether castling occurred

      • enPassant

        public boolean enPassant(int oldRow,
                         int oldCol,
                         int newRow,
                         int newCol)
        This method tests whether the pawn being moved is capable of being captured via the enPassant move.
        Parameters:
        oldRow - Old pawn row
        oldCol - Old pawn column
        newRow - new Pawn row
        newCol - new Pawn column
        Returns:
        boolean value for whether enPassant capture is capable on this pawn

      • isCheck

        public boolean isCheck(boolean isWhiteTurn)
        This method tests whether a King is currently in Check.
        Parameters:
        isWhiteTurn - the current turn
        Returns:
        boolean value for whether a King is in Check.
